findings.title: PRCM - Potential Referrals Counter Manipulation
findings.description: A malicious user could exploit the public `recordReferral` function by using multiple different wallets to refer the same account repeatedly, artificially inflating the `totalDirectReferrals` count of the user.

findings.title: ULI - Unnecessary Loop Iterations
findings.description: The contract uses a for loop within the `updateUplinesEarnings` and `balanceLeadershipRank` functions to iterate over the array `userUps`, but continues iterating after meeting the condition, potentially leading to unnecessary iterations.

findings.title: CO - Code Optimization
findings.description: The `getRewards` function has an inefficiency in calculating and assigning the `rewardAmount` variable, resulting in unnecessary computation and variable reassignment.

findings.title: LAFI - Leadership Amount Format Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract assigns values to the leadershipRanks mappings, but the value assigned to the fourth parameter of `leadershipRanks[5]` is not expressed in the 'ether' unit like the corresponding values in the other LeadershipRank structures.

findings.title: AOI - Arithmetic Operations Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract uses both SafeMath library and native arithmetic operations, which can introduce inconsistencies and undermine safety measures.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations.

findings.title: RSK - Redundant Storage Keyword
findings.description: The contract uses the `storage` keyword in a view function which is redundant as view functions do not modify the state of the contract and do not perform any actions that cost gas.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming conventions, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.
